column1: High Amount of Triglyceride in the Blood
column2: Jennek, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine should be taken off of the market!! The doctors should not have this medicine in their office as well!!My body was burning hot to the point where I couldn't cool off, even with freezing cold water.  My whole body was tingling and I started to feel warm then burning hot and my skin actually did hurt.  My face was puffy and bright red and felt extremely tight...I couldn't even move my lips for a few minutes.  I had to lay down on my moms' bed (my son and I are visiting for spring break), with a washrag and ice on top of my face.  I was trying hard not to cry because it truly frightened me and I didn't want my 10 year old to be worried about me.  I want everyone who is prescribed this medication to make sure they can handle the side effects.  If I weren't laying down, I would've passed out flat on the floor.  I do not reccommend this medication to anyone.  I'm going to go to weight watchers and I'm going to start exercising.  I'm done with these medicines.  Good luck to everyone out there.  Remember ask your doctor about "flushing," do not take any medicine without reading the information that comes with it.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I asked about specific side effects then read other reviews now here is my story ..I was out of state w/my sister I took the asprin my doctor recmended then 30 min later took the niaspan about one hour later I awoke burning from head to toe like I had fire in my viens and prickly feeling all over this made me sick at my stomach so I got up to go to restroom the last thing I remember is sitting on the toliet then I came too on the bathroom floor in a hotel no less ..If I would have been alone I would have been  in a lot of trouble I was dizzy the whole next day..I will NEVER take this drug again some one could die from this in my opinion..

column2: budweizer, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Twice I have broken out with my face and ears swelling.  My whole body turning red and itching.  First time I thought I had an allergic reaction to a new memory foam mattress I was trying out for a possible bed replacement.  Ended up in the emergency room.  I didn't know what the heck was going on.  Was given benadryl and another medicine.  Symptoms went away.  Then a few days later sat down to eat breakfast and  the burning, itching, and swelling was there again.  Was told by family member to STOP taking the medicine and call doctor when holidays over. Wouldn't recommend this drug to anyone.  Got to be a better way.

column9: Awakened every night by intense "burning skin" sensation. My physician says it's a known side-effect, but I find it quite disturbing that the body exhibits such a dramatic negative response.

column1: High Amount of Triglyceride in the Blood
column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I experienced a severe side effect of burning from my neck to my knees accompanied by a fine red rash and itching which initially I thought was prickly heat.  I have experienced hot flashes in the past; this reaction was no hot flash!  It was an outright BURNING sensation with an intensity that rendered me completely incapable of assisting myself for a good 5 minutes.  I felt the drug company literature completely inadequate at informing me of the possibility of such a severe reaction.  This drug may prove beneficial but I feel the severe side effects outweigh any benefits.

column9: I was taking 500mg per day.  The doctor increased the dosage to 1000mg per day.  I had no ill effects with the original dose.  The increased dose has caused itching, hot flashes.  I will tolerate this condition until my next doctor visit.
